paper_abstract: Given a convex disk K (a convex compact planar set with nonempty interior), let delta (L) (K) and theta (L) (K) denote the lattice packing density and the lattice covering density of K, respectively. We prove that for every centrally-symmetric convex disk K we have that 1 <= delta(L)(K) <= 1.17225 ... The left inequality is tight and it improves a 10-year old result.
paper_title: Packing and Covering with Centrally Symmetric Convex Disks
